result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicole M. Meudt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicole M. Meudt

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief

10:28 AM Defendant Nicole M. Meudt in court.  Attorney Timothy Luke Angel in court for Nicole M. Meudt.  Attorney Zachary P Leigh in court for State of Wisconsin. State recites joint recommendation:  Cts 1 & 2:  W/H 24 mo probation:  counseling as recommended by DOC;  10 hrs comm service, each count; DNA submission.  Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant. Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form - colloquy given.  Defendant freely, willingly, knowledgeably and intelligently enters into the plea agreement and joint recommendation. Court accepts the joint recommendation and sentences the defendant accordingly.

8:42 AM Defendant Nicole M. Meudt appeared by video.  Attorney Timothy Luke Angel appeared by video for Nicole M. Meudt.  Attorney Zachary P Leigh in court for State of Wisconsin.  Atty Angel advises there is an offer but request for an adjournment to work out some remaining issues.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on September 15, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Status conference on September 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Petition to Assign Cases Subject to Disqualification and Chief Judge Order Specifically Assigning Cases

11:03 AM Defendant Nicole M. Meudt in court.  Attorney Timothy Luke Angel in court for Nicole M. Meudt.  Attorney Matthew C. Allen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Request for further status.  Further request to modify bond to drop no contact provision with H.T.  State reluctantly agrees to modify bonds accordingly.  Court will amend any bonds containing this provision and replace it with no violent, abusive or profane conduct.
Status conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on September 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Nicole M. Meudt
Current: 425 Aster Street #121, Lone Rock, WI 53556 United States  (Effective: 02-14-2022)
Prior: 3143 South Main Street, Edmund, WI 53535

Booking; no violent, abusive or profane conduct; no contact with Hunter Thornton or his residence.  Defendant is to contact the Iowa County Sheriff's Department at 608-935-9500 to make arrangements for booking by 04/30/2022.

10:43 AM Defendant Nicole M. Meudt in court with Atty Tim Angel.  Attorney Curtis E. Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin.   Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant. Waiver of formal reading of complaint. Defendant stands mute - not guilty plea entered.  Requesst for $250 signature bond - no violent, abusive or profane conduct; no contact with H.T. or his residence.  Atty Angel motions to remove the no contact provision and gives basis.  Court orders:  $250 signature bond - no violent, abusive or profane conduct; no contact with H.T. or his residence.
Motion on postconviction relief hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Motion on postconviction relief hearing on June 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.
